column3: Thanks @nolim1t. Unless this change is backported to 0.21.1, by the time 22.0 (the next release) is out tor v2 will be EOL, so maybe the existing release notes are enough. It may be good to squash your commits down to one when you are finished.

> Thanks @nolim1t. Unless this change is backported to 0.21.1, by the time 22.0 (the next release) is out tor v2 will be EOL, so maybe the existing release notes are enough. It may be good to squash your commits down to one when you are finished.\n\nSquashed into one. Yep I recognize that it may be deprecated too, hence not recommended mention
We're on the trailing edge of TorV2 support here, and this is a really hacky workaround. I too think that the mention in the release notes is enough. No strong objection though.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->
